Tamura Ginnosuke merits some further commentary. He was in the thick
of act=
ion during the Boshin War, and his testimony on the war is vital
for anyone=
 who wants an eyewitness account of some of the most ignored
parts of the w=
ar. For instance, Tamura comments on the fighting men of
the Sendai domain,=
 who played an important part in the war in the
north, but who are largely =
ignored by most Japanese and by pretty much
all western scholars.

All of t=
his testimony, some of which is quoted in some of the better
Japanese-langu=
age history websites, is made even more poignant by the
fact that he was a =
child of 12-13 years at the time...

-M.
